Santa_Monica.Majestic Crest Theatre: The Crest Theatre (formerly known as Majestic Crest and Bigfoot Crest Theatre) is a movie theatre located in the Westwood neighborhood of Los Angeles, California, United States. It was founded as the Westwood Theatre in 1940, and was built for live performances but switched to a newsreel cinema during World War II. Through ownership changes, it has been known at various times as UCLAN Theatre, Crest Theatre, and Metro Theatre. The original 500-seat art deco style theater was designed by Arthur W. Hawes.
